The admin tried to be clever by using the same prime twice in RSA. Can you recover the message from this ciphertext? 1804097642697853472411749869107224866367959984548841252339552036170465962626729405322527378292376261982135154604429912887826440805345682452784636289463046

The flag format is flag{...}
n=5424771955533189493637753867777956430817246315852342157883918965695631828838571368633520204944157471958860972875563330903334284685953851856412019184261009, e=2603332277056514934407979852727476714607274956890410941045275967536424515039184912958696616438320823816813151268198619362659945710691858401207329704330069

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{yat6pwuo}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 1804097642697853472411749869107224866367959984548841252339552036170465962626729405322527378292376261982135154604429912887826440805345682452784636289463046
vulnerability: repeated primes
hint: The RSA modulus n is a perfect square. This often indicates a repeated prime usage vulnerability.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=5424771955533189493637753867777956430817246315852342157883918965695631828838571368633520204944157471958860972875563330903334284685953851856412019184261009, e=2603332277056514934407979852727476714607274956890410941045275967536424515039184912958696616438320823816813151268198619362659945710691858401207329704330069
extra_info: p=73653051230299953498190355254321483453391054194162451590697448383566048668503, q=73653051230299953498190355254321483453391054194162451590697448383566048668503, Ï†(n)=5424771955533189493637753867777956430817246315852342157883918965695631828838424062531059605037161091248352329908656548794945959782772456959644887086924004
subtype: repeated_prime_usage
archetype: rsa
